title: WAF rule groups
description: A group of Web Application Firewall (WAF) rules that share common functionality and traits.

links.title: Get WAF rule groups
links.description: Fetches the WAF rule groups in a WAF package.

name.description: The name of the rule group.

mode.description: The state of the rules contained in the rule group. When `on`, the rules in the group are configurable/usable.

rules_count.description: The number of rules in the current rule group.

page.description: The page number of paginated results.

per_page.description: The number of rule groups per page.

order.description: The field used to sort returned rule groups.

direction.description: The direction used to sort returned rule groups.

match.description: When set to `all`, all the search requirements must match. When set to `any`, only one of the search requirements has to match.

links.title: Get a WAF rule group
links.description: Fetches the details of a WAF rule group.
links.response:
{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [],
  "messages": [],
  "result": {
    "id": "de677e5818985db1285d0e80225f06e5",
    "name": "Project Honey Pot",
    "description": "Group designed to protect against IP addresses that are a threat and typically used to launch DDoS attacks",
    "rules_count": 10,
    "modified_rules_count": 2,
    "package_id": "a25a9a7e9c00afc1fb2e0245519d725b",
    "mode": "on",
    "allowed_modes": [
      "on",
      "off"
    ]
  }
}

links.title: Update a WAF rule group
links.description: Updates a WAF rule group. You can update the state (`mode` parameter) of a rule group.

mode.description: The state of the rules contained in the rule group. When `on`, the rules in the group are configurable/usable.

links.response:
{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [],
  "messages": [],
  "result": {
    "id": "de677e5818985db1285d0e80225f06e5",
    "name": "Project Honey Pot",
    "description": "Group designed to protect against IP addresses that are a threat and typically used to launch DDoS attacks",
    "rules_count": 10,
    "modified_rules_count": 2,
    "package_id": "a25a9a7e9c00afc1fb2e0245519d725b",
    "mode": "on",
    "allowed_modes": [
      "on",
      "off"
    ]
  }
}

id.description: The unique identifier of the rule group.

name.description: The name of the rule group.

description.example: "Group designed to protect against IP addresses that are a threat and typically used to launch DDoS attacks"
description.description: An informative summary of what the rule group does.

rules_count.description: The number of rules in the current rule group.

modified_rules_count.description: The number of rules within the group that have been modified from their default configuration.

package_id.description: The unique identifier of a WAF package.

mode.description: The state of the rules contained in the rule group. When `on`, the rules in the group are configurable/usable.

allowed_modes.description: The available states for the rule group.

items.description: The state of the rules contained in the rule group. When `on`, the rules in the group are configurable/usable.

object_definition.example:
{
  "id": "de677e5818985db1285d0e80225f06e5",
  "name": "Project Honey Pot",
  "description": "Group designed to protect against IP addresses that are a threat and typically used to launch DDoS attacks",
  "rules_count": 10,
  "modified_rules_count": 2,
  "package_id": "a25a9a7e9c00afc1fb2e0245519d725b",
  "mode": "on",
  "allowed_modes": [
    "on",
    "off"
  ]
}
object_definition.title: WAF rule groups
object_definition.description: A group of Web Application Firewall (WAF) rules that share common functionality and traits.
